Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: pampaul1963
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay very much. stayed 5 nights and our room was always clean. Every morning we had breakfast at the cafe at the hotel and the service and food were great. The staff at the cafe made us feel right at home. The chocolate gravy is a must try in fact I brought home 4 packages with us. Thanks for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best breakfast deals around”
Reviews.Author: Quidam65
Reviews.Content: When looking at the property, one may think that the breakfast offering will be sparse. But they have a wide variety of choices on the free continental breakfast, and for only $4 they will cook a hot breakfast for you (but you can't charge it to your room). Also the breakfast area is in the back of the property (not the front so you aren't bumping into travelers checking out). The only complaints were that 1) the air conditioner will freeze you out if you aren't careful and 2) one of the vending machines (3rd breezeway) will take your money and not give you product (but the front desk gave me a refund).

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: Divemedic72450
Reviews.Content: I rented two rooms for two nights. My room was good, cool air, clean bathrooms, carpet looked clean, but our socks was dirty from walking around the room. Over all stay was average for this room. The other room was about the same but for the air condition. We checked in, turned on the air went to SDC until it closed. Came back and the room was warm. I went to check on it myself. The unit looked like it was 20 years old or older, and wasn't cooling. I called the office and they said we could move my family to another room at midnight. I know things like this does happen. But that unit need to be replaced years ago. And I am sure it wasn't working before we arrived. Pools was real nice. If you are looking for a reasonable room $54 then you will get what you pay for. The staff was nice, but no one offered to make any adjustments on our bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Guthrie-Five
Reviews.Content: For the price, this hotel was perfect for our 3 day Branson trip. The staff was very welcoming-the front desk as well as those in the breakfast area. Our family was very comfortable here and would not hesitate to stay here again. Oh....and the location was also perfect...not bumper to bumper like on 76. Thank you Quality Inn for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “No Quality at this Inn anymore!!”
Reviews.Author: KelsHill
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here repeatedly over many years, but have noticed a severe decline in the past few visits in the quality, service, cleanliness, upkeep, etc. I will no longer be returning after this stay that resulted in me checking out days earlier than I had planned and staying elsewhere. WiFI was not accessible and after initially being told it was a problem with my computer as noone else staying was having problems but me, the staff told me they have had issues with no WiFi for quite some time now. Maintenance did reset the router once and I was able to access internet for about 20 minutes only. Taking a shower resulted in 4 plus inches of standing water in the tub. The shower curtain was so long that you stepped on it while showering and it floated in the standing water and was grossly stained along the bottom edge from repeatedly being in stagnant water. The toilet backed up and I was told they could not find a plunger, but I could change rooms at midnight while my children were sleeping. Finally a plunger was found but toilet continued to overflow. I was told "ok" when I said I would go purchase my own plunger and take care of the situation myself. I was able to get the toilet to work for about a day only. Sink also backed up. Room had a recliner that required super human force to become upright again after reclining, thus you could not recline in it unless someone else was present to get you out of it. Carpet turned our socks black. Housekeeping ignored massive quantities of crumbs and never did vacuum them once recliner was moved. Only positive aspect was breakfast. Lots of choices. I was told this hotel is up for sale and that current management/owners were doing nothing anymore on upkeep. I suggest you stay elsewhere till they get someone in there who cares again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price!”
Reviews.Author: elle_travels
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel 3 times, and every time, the customer service was outstanding. At our most recent stay, the desk clerk, Reilly, was very courteous, helpful, and fast. The staff at breakfast were all smiles and very welcoming. Our room (in the front building) was clean and quiet, and the space was adequate for our family of 4. Our children enjoyed the indoor pool. The location makes it convenient to everything. The decor in the room was dated, and the wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling a little behind the door, but overall, the room was fine. For the price, this hotel is great! I'm sure that we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Room is worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: Marcus W
Reviews.Content: Just a basic clean hotel located on the outskirts of Branson, MO. Easily assessable to lots of great shows and eating places.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jmdanderson
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights here and was made to feel like a 5 star hotel there was a group of 25 from our Southside Church from atoka ok. my first time here was so impressed with the staff most friendly people very profssional but made us all feel so welcome and the people at the breakfast bar was the best in the world meet all our need far more than anyother hotel you should be so proud of such good employees working to make you feel so good and thank you carla for such a good clean room will only stay here when i go back to Branson again thank you

Reviews.Title: “pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Lois M
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at the Quality Inn. One of the most awesome experiences is in the restaurant where LaDonna, Steve, & Carla do an exceptional job of making guests feel like family. I believe they are responsible for much valuable PR work and create much repeat business. Enjoy the pool and hot tub and convenience to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Brookhart Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: Libby G
Reviews.Content: We had our family reunion at this hotel in June and I have to say Sheldon was so wonderful at accomodating us with everything we needed. Then we meet the kitchen staff LaDoona, Steve, Carla & Mikie they are absolutely wonderful people. The owner has to be very proud of his employees. Thanks for everything you all done for us to make our stay wonderful:)

Reviews.Title: “Worst motel I have ever stayed in! Very unsanitary”
Reviews.Author: Family_is_life101
Reviews.Content: Me and my family came here on a family vacation and when we booked it, we were told we would get a indoor room, we ended up outdoor. from the outside, it looks okay but as soon as you walk inside, the smell hits you like a brick wall. It smelled like mold and dirty water. The carpet was filthy and the walls were falling apart. The beds were hard and the sheets stained. We thought it was this room so we asked for another and got moved. The 2nd room was just as bad if not worse. So we delt with it and next morning went down to the breakfast room. They had alot of choices and very good food. There were 3 workers in the breakfast room. Two.younger ones and a old lady. After sitting down, I looked over and saw the old lady just dip her hand in and eating bacon right out of the tray they serve people from. At that point I stoped eating. On our way out, I heard the same old lady talking to the boy complaining about some of the guest. Very bad motel and id rather sleep in my car then come here another night. I will be telling people about this horrible place so they dont make the same mistake I did.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: LBeuerle
Reviews.Content: I was an escort on a tour bus from Frankenmuth/Superior Travel from Michigan. There were 36 of us total. We stayed in the large, four-floor building in the back. Our rooms was very, very nice....recently renovated. The hotel employees, including Misty, the manager, and the Cafe staff were spectacular!!!! They all bent-over backwards to make our four-night stay a huge success! Luggage was delivered to our rooms upon arrival and then picked up in a timely manner when we departed. The food in the Cafe was delicious!! I asked for the names of the employees in the Cafe, but I stupidly misplaced the paper w/the names. I do remember Carla & Steve Milach, however. Carla & Steve will pick up items for you or take you to places in the area for tips only....no other charge!!! They, in fact, picked up a prescription for a person and brought it back to the hotel. Now, how many hotels will do that??? The lady who cooked really ROCKED!! That woman can cook eggs like no other!!! Thank you so much! There was a huge selection of food for breakfast....most of it free. Even the food you pay for was EXTREMELY REASONABLE with many choices. They even have big bottles of frozen water to purchase for only a dollar. ALL OF YOU ROCK!!! Thank you so much for helping to make our trip a true SUCCESS. I look forward to seeing you all again. Linda Beuerle

Reviews.Title: “No quality noted in this hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: cnh624
Reviews.Content: I was not pleased with the accomodations. I would not stay here again for the following reasons. 1. The room had a sticky substance on the floor and bathroom was dingy/shabby. 2. We were told we would have an indoor corridor room (we were given an outside room at check in) I had no idea there was an indoor corridor area at the very rear of the property until we walked around to go to the pool. 3. There were rowdy teenagers in the pool area so we were unable to enjoy the indoor pool. I could not find anyone at the front desk to express my concerns to and even called the 1-800 number for Choice Hotels to express my dismay with the accomodations. They also were unable to get anyone at the front desk to answer the phone. As I was traveling with two small boys I could not keep trotting up to the front desk area to seek assistance regarding the room concerns or the pool concerns. And since they were not in there and not answering calls I called the 1-800 for assistance. Choice Hotels continued to try to call the front desk and were unable to get an answer either. 4. The next morning we tried to eat breakfast but they were woefully understaffed to handle the massive tour bus crowd that was there and be able to feed my family. The staff was cheerful and certainly tried to accomodate everyone but there was a such a large crowd they simply could not keep up and it was truly wall to wall people in there. 5. I had difficulty sleeping as a large 18-wheeler truck parallel parked outside the room around 11:00 p.m. and its engine rumbled most of the evening. 6. At check in you can see there is a ticket office in the lobby, I inquired about purchasing tickets for some shows/events in the area and was told to come back in the morning but not too early. When I asked what was considered "too early" was told that I should not come until the box offices opened but no one seemed able to give me a time to return. The final analysis is that I would not stay at this hotel again nor would I recommend it to family/friends. We were able to find better accomodations for the rest of the week in Branson. As for location I am unsure as to whether or not this is a good location for Branson. It is across the street from the Shoji Tabuchi Theater.

Reviews.Title: “Essentials met, yet gro-DEE!”
Reviews.Author: MrsMusic28
Reviews.Content: Out of the hundrreds of hotels in Branson - if you're going to pay with your own hard earned American dollars - look elsewhere. But if someone else is paying, it'll do. Plusses are...hot water, comfy bed, and warm indoor pool/hot tub. Minuses are... Stinky grody-mody stench, ripped old wallpaper, nasty carpet, and did I mention the smell? It's like they've oversprayed a floral disinfectant and instead of taking away smoke and other smells, it's only combined the two for a repulsive odor! Upon driving up, we noticed the rooms had outside opening rooms, not happy about that, but trying to remain positive. We check in and find out that were staying in the back of the property which has inside opening rooms, so I'm happier - until we get inside, then the smell hits me like a brick! Pee-YUCKIE POO! As we walk to the elevator I notice the 80's mauve/pink flowery pattern on the sofa and carpet. Once on our floor, my eyes immediately go to the wallpaper and it's unevenness and ripped places. As we walk down the dimly lit hallway, we find our room, insert our keycard and it doesn't work! My hubby has to drive all the way to the front to get the keycard fixed and in the meantime, were doing the pee-pee dance! Finally we get in the room and it was nice and cold! We remove the outer bedspread, and lay down on a pretty comfy bed, despite the stench! Walk to look out the window and notice the corner of the carpet doesn't match up to the wall, you can see the concrete floor and the carpet pad underneath! Just little things that aren't taken care of, just half-butt done, ya know? Anyway other than those things it wasnt the absolute grodiest, but it's pretty close!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Patricia C
Reviews.Content: We were there for the Orphan Car Show on September 9 and 10, 2011. Called ahead of time, told the person about were we wanted our room to be and it was perfect. We found out later that we were right next to some friends that we only get to see at the Orphan Car Shows.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: Charles P
Reviews.Content: Room was too small for the beds, bathroom was small and difficult to get around in. I requested help with a equipment problem, no one ever showed up or called back. I stay at Choice Hotels almost exclusively, and this is the first truly negative experience I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Fergusonx4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was referred to us by friends that go to branson alot. The rooms are very clean and good size. The bed was very comfortable. They have a continental breakfast that includes cereal, fruit, muffins, bagels,biscuits and gravy, doughnuts, juices and coffee. For $4 dollars you can have eggs, omeletes, bacon, hashbrowns etc. This is a good price for a cooked breakfast. We reserved a room with a king size bed and the price was $55.00 a night before tax. I don't like to pay alot of money for a room because all you do is sleep there. They have an indoor pool, an outdoor pool and a exercise room. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it once was!!!”
Reviews.Author: CountryBoy7123
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there multiple times in the past but this time will probably be the last!!! First our room was 80-85 degrees. Next tried to get ice and three of the four machines were broken. I had to walk about a block to the back of the property to get ice. Talked to the night desk person and he said "sorry but I can't do anything about it" !!! Not the kind of service I was looking for!!! Do not stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice place overall”
Reviews.Author: wildcat5415
Reviews.Content: we have stayed in this hotel several times and have always had a positive experience. i reviewed this hotel once before,( last year), and things are pretty much exactly the same this year. fairly nice, we enjoyed our stay. they still could use some new carpet, it is worn and frayed in places, not horrible though. they could stand to update their tv's as well, still have those box tv's. could use some flat panels, and could stand to be a bit larger. other than that our stay was good and i would definately stay again. one thing this hotel has going for it is the pool situation. they have an outdoor and indoor pool. the indoor pool area is nice, with a hot tub and gaming area (this is probably what brings us back again and again, my daughter loves it). breakfast in sufficient to get your day started, basically continental breakfast with biscuits and gravy added. they will sell you a full breakfast for an additional charge. staff is very nice, beds are comfy, and having 4 pillows per bed is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Jayco-man
Reviews.Content: This motel is not on the strip. That's a plus in my book. Rooms are clean, bathroom was very clean. We stay here regularly when in Branson because it;s convenient to Easternmost stoplight to Silver Dollar City. Sometimes we get a room with a noisy air conditioner, but for the value, that's not much of a problem. The breakfast bar has donuts, bagels, several types of muffins. several types of fresh fruit, milk, coffee, 4 types of juices, 3 types of cereal, and sausage gravy and biscuits. And for only 4.00, you can order several different hot made to order breakfast meals with pancakes, ham, sausage, bacon, fried tator The chef even remembered my name the second day I ordered a hot breakfast, and was very friendly.s and eggs. They also have an indoor pool and hot tub and an outdoor pool. There is also a laundry in the indoor pool facility. Of course we'll stayagain the next time we're in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “"Amazing Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: fuzzies
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are amazing. They were so helpful to us after we left another hotel for being so bad. We had been here previous years, but had wanted to try something new. They told us they only had a room available for that night and gave us the AAA discount even though we had forgot our card. They put on our names on the list in case a room opened up the next night, which one did and they gave it to us and we were able to move in right away instead of having to wait in for check in time again. The hotel beds were so comfortable with even better pillows. The indoor and outdoor pool were great. The hot tub is really nice too. This hotel is nice because its away from the strip but there is still stuff around it like an icecream shop and some gift shops. Once again, the staff was so incredibly nice and helpful!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Chestersmomma
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to save money this hotel was ok. It was decently clean but we were in the inside building in the back. Not unsatisfied and will probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “on the way down hill...”
Reviews.Author: dannifer
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel 3 different times and this will be our last. It's getting worse each time. I think it really depends what room you get, some of them I guess are nicer than others. One time our room was in the adjacent building to the back of the property though - those rooms are awful! Our room this time was in the main building and was fairly clean but in bad need of a remodel. The carpet was pretty gross, the furnishings were very old, the bathroom so small you could barely open the door without hitting the toilet. Granted it's supposed to just be your average hotel nothing fancy but overall it just looked run down and old, with a questionable quality of cleanliness. The beds were comfortable enough though. This hotel does have 2 pools, one outdoor and one indoor and both are great. That may be the only thing saving this place. So back to the bad - the breakfast. The free one that you get for staying there is in their "restaurant" at the back of the hotel. VERY limited offerings unless you want to buy something off their menu which I guess is what they are hoping. So overall I would not recommend this place especially for the price they charge. We had points for a free stay which is the only reason we chose it. It was do-able being free for us, but I would not pay to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if will stay again...”
Reviews.Author: motelCarlisleIa
Reviews.Content: The bed was clean and comfy but the carpet looked dirty and the plumbing was in need of repair. The sink was not very clean. The free breakfast was good. The price was hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: minntac
Reviews.Content: I agree with a previous reviewer. The beds were comfortable. The staff very pleasant and helpful. This is a facility that needs major overhaul. Linoleum coming loose in the bathroom. A/C was noisy. They have a very weird drain system in the bathroom sink. We've stayed in other Quality Inns with a lot better quality in the building. I was part of a tour and didn't have a choice or I might have changed to a different place after the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed quality”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior444
Reviews.Content: Good location off strip but close to attractions. Difficult to find entrance drive. Reasonably priced. Room clean but worn and in need of repairs and upgrade. Great bed and pillows though. Noisy air conditioner. Overwhelming odor of cleaning solutions throughout halls and in the room. The place needs a good airing out. Staff friendly and professional. Wifi works good once you figure out how to access it. They offer a great continental breakfast in a cafe on the premises with the option to purchase cooked foods in addition to the free continental items- with very friendly and funny staff! Would stay there again but only if rooms were free of the heavy disinfectant odor.

Reviews.Title: “Overall 'meh'”
Reviews.Author: newb_in_missouri
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Branson for our 6th wedding anniversary. Originally he booked a package deal from Branson shows.com and he had asked for a jacuzzi suite at the Grand Oaks hotel which is located right on the strip. Well, at the last minute they informed us that the room we wanted wasn't available *the day before we were to leave* so they 'worked hard' to accomodate us in a jacuzzi suite equally as nice somewhere else. This is where the Quality Inn came into play.. Like I said, overall it was 'meh', We were given the key card to our 'jacuzzi suite' and found it was just a one person jet tub located in the bathroom. Kind of misleading. However the public hot tub and pool was nice so we used those. The room was big and pretty clean. The beds were hard, so if you have bad backs you may be sore after sleeping in them. We were given a coupon for a free 'continental' breakfast which, when I called the front desk the night before and asked them what it included he told me "donuts, cereal, juice, biscuits, gravy, etc etc AND an omlette bar with sausage and bacon' Cool! However when we went down there we discovered the omlettes, eggs, meats were at an additional charge. Boo! We went less than a mile down the street to IHOP! I guess this place is ok if you want to get a place next to the Shoji theater and someplace off the busy strip. I guess we were just expecting more when we got there.. Oh well, lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel rooms need major cleaning & remodel, restaurant staff super nice, pool ok”
Reviews.Author: boozer2
Reviews.Content: If it were not for the ABSOLUTELY wonderful staff in the restaurant at this hotel (where you eat continental breakfast each morning) this stay would have been a completely negative stay. The restaurant staff were friendly, helpful and made the visit enjoyable. The carpet in the rooms are disgusting, I put towels down on the floor because my feet/shoes kept sticking to the floor. The rooms need major remodeling. The "workout" room was a cement slab building next to the outdoor pool, that had worn out/old equipment and was not heated at all and it was 40+- degrees in there. I can say I spent all of 20 minutes in there until I couldn't take it anymore. Indoor pool was large and ok compared to the rest of the hotel. I would not have stayed here more than one night if I had made the reservations, but we were staying with another couple who had made the reservations and were afraid they would lose their deposit money so we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lindalou530
Reviews.Content: We arrived early before check-in and they were very accomodating and found us a good room. There weren't supposed to be any animals in our section but across the hall someone had sneaked one in. It was scratching on the door and barking. We called the front desk and they said they'd take care of this matter, which they did almost immediately! Across the street was a highly recommended show, Shoji Tabouchi, which is loved by everyone. The room was very clean and the bathroom was well kept. Our room was in the back section and very quiet...away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and comfortable facilities”
Reviews.Author: King004
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Inn for several years with complete satisfaction. This year was even better as they have installed new furnishings and the beds were the most comfortable I have had in any motel. The day always gets off to a good start with a visit to the breakfast room where lovely LaDonna and her friendly staff serve a delicious hot breakfast complete with smiles and friendly conversation. The location is great. Housekeeping is excellent. I would recommend this location to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed at this Inn for several...”
Reviews.Author: bettytovar
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Inn for several uears because its always been great. We love the breakfast restaurant and the operator LaDonna is always waonderful

Reviews.Title: “staff made this a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LJS55
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were welcomed by the staff who proved helpful and gracious. The restaurant was great and the staff - including LaDonna and Katie - were genuinely welcoming and started our day off with big smiles. Housekeeping was excellent and our one concern (hairdryer) was immediately taken care of. Location was great and staff was very helpful in giving directions. Our first time visit to Branson was enhanced by our experience at this Quality Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay!!”
Reviews.Author: mchllprpllz
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for 5 days and really enjoyed our stay. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room were clean and very nice. My son loved the pool very clean and cool. We were there when it was the HOTTEST! They offer discount tickets to many shows. The breakfast was ok. They had eggs, pancakes, cereal, biscuts n gravey and donuts. It was fine the first couple of days but by the 3rd day I could have used alittle more variety. That would really be my only suggestion. The pool was down but they worked on it all day and it was up and running by the end of day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Very pet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: kob3838
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel for it's cleanliness and staff was nice, was not able to check in until 3 pm but we took the dog out for a walk until then. There was a outside pool and indoor pool we really liked, and some things to do around the hotel..would not recommend staying on the strip it was very crowded and traffic was horrible..this hotel is off the strip but a great location and big place to walk the doggies if you have one.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: armywife2010_10
Reviews.Content: The price is great, the location is great, the service was just fine. You'll see a lot of people stating it needs an update/remodel. Although that is true, it is just cosmetic. We didn't spend much time in our room at all--so for us, the 80's carpet and decor didn't matter. :0 Overall the rooms were clean. The carpet needed to be steam cleaned. We couldn't walk across it w/out our feet turning black, so we just wore shoes and socks in the room when we were there. Staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was Ok. There are not ANY choices on the complimentary buffet suitable for diabetic or carb restricted diets. The kitchen, though, does make eggs, meats, etc-you just have to pay $4 for it. The location was perfect. It is on the "quieter side" of everything, which we appreciated. both of the pools were nice. The exercise equip. was broken, however when we were there. Overall, Ok. If you are vacationing on a budget, or traveling w/a pet, it is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “It's like staying with family.”
Reviews.Author: travelersLafayette
Reviews.Content: This is an amazingly friendly hotel. Any employee you come across has a friendly welcome such as "good morning". Each and every employee puts 100% effort into their job. They are all ready to help in any way possible. Josh, the front desk clerk, is wonderful. He goes above and beyond his requirements to insure you have an excellent experience in Branson. Thank you for a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “ok place.”
Reviews.Author: wildcat5415
Reviews.Content: hotel is nothing fancy but rooms are ok, staff fairly nice. nice place to stay with kids with not only the outdoor pool but with an even bigger indoor pool with hot-tub and gaming area. could stand some new carpet in the rooms. pictures of rooms when you make your reservations are not accurate, they show fridge and microwaves, but you find out after you get to your room and they arent there that they cost an additional $10. there was a little barking dog in the next room that kept us up. breakfast is ok, basic bagels, donuts and cereal, but they did offer biscuits and gravy which was good. but dont forget your breakfast "ticket" or the lady will get annoyed. they try to sell you breakfast when you first get in there, but keep walking, the "free" stuff is just beyond them. location is fairly good, off the super busy strip. overall, a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very good nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vickymarie2010
Reviews.Content: They treat you very good and the hotel rooms are nice. The beds are very comfortable and big nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: iservehim
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was okay, it was over at 9 and that is when we get out. Should have been till 10 or 10:30. The ceilings were cracked, the room was small, the toilet was dirty, the tub was flaking. We got to Branson and they told us we couldn't check in till 3, that was fine, but at 3 we got back there and we had to wait till 5 for the room to be cleaned. The next time we went back, we avoided this location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Would stay again! One bad breakfast server....”
Reviews.Author: signgirl79
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at this hotel and was VERY pleased. I called late one night to reserve a room. The person answering the phone was VERY nice. When I checked in that same person was able to give me an even lower rate than he had quoted over the phone. The room was spotless and spacious. The location is perfect. Also, the staff was very helpful at acquiring discounted show tickets for me. Breakfast included eggs, pancakes, bisquits and gravy....plent to start your day off right! I have only two complaints about this hotel. I've decided to give it a 5 star rating anyway though. First, the parking lot is horrible. However, that isn't the hotels fault. Hills just can't be helped in Branson. Also, there was one food service worker who was VERY loud and kept touching the pancakes, oranges, and bisquits with her bare hands!!!!!!!!!!!! I couldn't believe it!!! :-( I was really grossed out and although the food looked good....I just couldn't bear to eat it!

Reviews.Title: “STAY ANYWHERE ELSE!!!”
Reviews.Author: mkmahaf
Reviews.Content: We visited here for a family vacation, and we were very disappointed. The carpet was nasty and lumpy and had iron burns all over it. There were little curly hairs on the blanket. The coffee pot was dirty from the last people that stayed in the room. The TV was about a 15 inch tv with wood paneling...remote did not work. Sink in the bathroom is so cracked I thought it was going to fall in. housekeeping never serviced my room. The breakfast staff was great but they really shouldn't cut bananas in half...that is just gross. Overall a bad experience...my advice to anyone is stay anywhere else besides here!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: momofzjc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in adjoining rooms for my sons birthday party with his friends. The rooms were a little old but they were very clean, hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They have a great indoor pool area with arcade games and a pool table which was great for all of the kids to play. Location was great, easy to get to everything without being on "the strip" much less congestion. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better from Quality Inn”
Reviews.Author: banditD
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel through Explore Branson with a "Last Minute Deal" (2 nights hotel, show, breakfast and VIP coupon book. This hotel has seen better days. It felt clean but needs updating. Location is directly across from Shoji. Breakfast was basically continental and you could upgrade to hot food for $4 (We were told "breakfast buffet"). I also chose a Quality Inn as a Choice Hotel for the rewards. After our stay I was told because we booked through a third party, no reward points were available. We had a great time but think we could have gotten more for our money. Internet in the lobby was out of order the entire week we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cheyenne45
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before in the back building and it was a little nicer than the front building but the room was clean and the breakfast was great!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: Evildeadfan123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quality Inn On The Strip from September 7th, and Checked Out September 10th, with my Husband, Brian, for a Belated Honeymoon. We stayed in a Jaczuzzi Suite, with a King Bed. The bed was excellent, very comfortable. There were no smells, the bathroom, and Jacuzzi were clean. Carpet was very clean. Deluxe Breakfast was really good, and the location was perfect, Close to Presley's Country Jubilee, Liverpool Legends and Titanic Museum. The outdoor pool was gorgeous, but it was a little too cold to swim in it. The indoor pool was a little cloudy, and the Spa was foamy, otherwise it was really nice, and FREE WI-FI

Reviews.Title: “Branson, Mo - Quality Inn, Shepherd of the Hills Expressway - Poor Quality”
Reviews.Author: MissyArkansas
Reviews.Content: Date: Stayed here Sept. 4-7, 2009 My husband & I stayed here for a weekend getaway to Branson to see some shows, etc... The room was located in the very back building. It was not very clean. The bathroom floor was sticky, and the carpet was filthy. We did not go barefoot anywhere in the room, and our socks were filthy just walking around for a few minutes. The room had a bad pet odor, probably from the nasty carpet, which had a sticky, nasty residue on the surface of it. The area around the air conditioner unit was filthy, probably not cleaned for months. The carpet in the outside corridor had huge wrinkles in it that someone could easily trip and fall over. The room was inexpensive so we were not expecting a whole lot, but at least we expected it to be clean. They really need to replace the carpet, there is no excuse for that. We will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good value, but in serious need of work.”
Reviews.Author: garnold
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights there, 09JUL-12JUL, and thought the location was perfect, off the main drag and close to HWY 76 to Whitewater and Silver Dollar City. The staff was very friendly, and the continental breakfast a very good value. The wireless high-speed internet came in very handy when I had to take care of some last minute, unexpected business. That's where the good part ends. We were in the 4-story back building, room 4115. The toilet seat was broke, the table wobbly, and the alarm clock broke. The second night there, we noticed our feet were dirty even after taking our showers. Then we realized that the carpet was absolutely filthy, even black with dirt. When we advised the front desk at checkout, the staff member said he realized that the place really needed work. A REAL SHAME. It could be much better with some common, everyday maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great indoor pool, and great rooms for the price!”
Reviews.Author: scoobie74
Reviews.Content: We looked at all the reviews before booking here and were a little worried about what the motel would actually be like. The room was great!!! We had a king suite with a fridge and microwave in it. The room was very clean. The furnishings were not new, but we don't expect new furniture. They had a good free breakfast but also had a hot breakfast that you could purchase for a very resonable price. The breakfast are also was open in the evenings (Wednesday thru Saturday). The indoor pool was great!! It was the best indoor pool! We stayed at the Quality Inn on the strip and it was much more costly than this Quality Inn and it was much more ran down. We would recommend the Quality Inn on Shepherd of the Hills Expy to all families visiting Branson. The couple minor problems that we had were taken care of quickly. The staff was great! We can't wait to go back!! Also, this is the first motel that we stayed at in Branson that the pool is open until midnight! They also have a washer/dryer in the indoor pool area which was great! The staff was great to accomadate to any needs that we had.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariejackson
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. I did read all the reviews before making plans. I do agree with that the hotel is showing it's age even the new part which is where we stayed. Even though the rooms were cleaned every day I felt they were a little bit dirty-because of the age of the hotel. The beds were comfortable although they do need new pillows- almost like not having one at all. The continental breakfast was enough, the front desk was very friendly, the pool area was nice, and they even put a microwave in our room. Comparing the looks of the hotel with others in the area it did look like it was one of the older hotels in the area. Would we stay there again-probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Needy”
Reviews.Author: Farmington_Mo_Catty
Reviews.Content: We tried to find a Comfort Inn Suites to stay at but they were booked. They sent us to a Best Western that was also, booked. We saw the vacancy sign and it didn't look to bad from the outside so we got a room with two beds on the ground floor. When we found the room it was cold as could be and I tried to turn the temperature down but it wouln't shut off, so I shut it down altogether. The room had a pass through door to the room next to ours and we didn't feel safe with that setup. The room was not real clean and the one bed sheet had a hole in it. There was a recliner chair over in the corner and when my husband sat in it , the seat just went to the flloor, it was junk. We moved it in front of the door between the rooms. We both didn't sleep well because of the ouside noise and the traffick all night long. just in and out and loud talking people. They gave us a coupon to present for our contintal breakfast where they had plates of eggs with fixings but they wanted $4.00 a plate and they looked to be cold. They said they had an outside pool and an indoor pool but we didn't look for them. In the morning when we were getting ready to leave we discovered that there was a new building with inside hallways right behind the one they placed us in, I felt cheated as I am sure the new building must have been in better shape and we would have felt safer in it. They didn't give us a choice nor mention the newer building and it was being used. I assume the indoor pool was in that building. We would have been glad to pay more if that was what it took to be in the better building. Our room had two deadbolts on the door one of which was missing the inside bar. It also had the old type chain locking device.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: jmelee80
Reviews.Content: My family & I have stayed at this hotel twice now, once in the old & new building. Although the rooms could be updated it is a nice place to stay. My kids loved the indoor pool, & my husband & I enjoyed the jacuzzi. With the contential breakfast and getting the room at a very reasonable rate, I cannot find anything to complain about. I read all the reviews, but decided to stay anyway and we had a very nice time. The staff was wonderful, and housekeeping was good also, new towels everyday, we had a great time. So if you want a 5 star hotel do not stay here but if you want a reasonable place to stay where you can sleep well and keep the rest of your money to spend on attractions then this is the hotelfot you.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: kcmotravelers
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this motel, this being our 3rd stay here. The motel is definitely showing its age! We were given a first floor room, in the newer section/pool building. The first thing we noticed was a huge crack which ran across the entire ceiling above the bed - It looked like there had been an earthquake! The wallpaper was peeling, the carpet dirty, the bedspread was torn, and the sink basin stained and cracked. Our room was directly across from the ice & vending machines, and was very, very noisy! The room was so-so clean, if you didn't look too closely. The "free" continental breakfast is quite limited unless you paid extra, but was adequate since we normally eat a light breakfast (bagel & an orange). We paid an additional $5 a night for a tiny refrigerator that was too cold, & our leftover subs and soda ended up frozen. Our room definitely needed updating/remodeling & repairs, (the 2nd floor room we had several years ago seemed much nicer/quieter.) Now, the "positives" - We only paid $58/night with fridge, booked thru the Quality Inn site - internet user/entertainment book rate ; this is one of the few motels in Branson that has both an indoor pool & hottub, and an outdoor pool- (nice in case it rains, and for those who like to sunbath!); the street location is slightly less congested than on the "strip", which makes it easier to pull out into traffic. I would consider this motel "adequate" (if you're not too picky and are looking for a bargain.)

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: liltravlers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the older building, and it defniitely needs an update. We noticed that the recliner in the room was a bit outdated. When we moved it to accomodate the rollaway, underneath we found a dead moth and other trash. My son had a good time in the pool, but as soon as he walked around on the carpet in the room, his feet were filthy on the bottom. The hotel should state whether guests will be located in the newer or older section of the hotel when booking. It apparently makes a big difference. We were not impressed with the breakfast offerings either.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: u1662u
Reviews.Content: Actually... we did not stay at this hotel. We booked our reservations through Vacations Made Easy (nothing against this business). My wife and I checked into this particular Quality Inn on Sept 08, 2007, at approximately 4:00 PM. We checked out about 15 minutes later. Why you may ask. Do you want to start with the amount of hair left in the bathtub... or the brown slimy stuff in the bottom of the sink. Or... the massive stain on the bed sheets. The carpets were also about 10 years past needing to be replaced. And after checking out... They still charged us for staying with them for the full week because we made our reservations through a travel company. (It's probably the only way they could stay in business) It may seem like my wife and I are fussy, But we are not. All we expect is a clean, comfortable room during our vacations. And, this just did NOT cut it at all. The word "Quality" should not be associated with this hotel at all. In all fairness... this was the room we were assigned. There is apparently a newer part of the hotel we did not see. It was the first impressions that did us in. Apparently others feel the same way. We stayed right next door, but somewhat kept an eye on the Quality Inn parking lot. Rarely were there more than a dozen cars at any given time. My suggestion... until they do some serious remodeling, find somewhere else. As I stated, we stayed right next door at a much cleaner, nicer hotel for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the reviews scare you!”
Reviews.Author: Letha
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this Quality Inn while following the Tour of MO. bike race. I was a little nervous when we discovered we were in the old building because I had seen some not so positive reviews. I was pleasantly surprised to find the room quite clean and comfortable! Yes, the sheets could have been newer, but they were snow white. The people at the front desk were cheerful and quite helpful when I ask for directions. The maid was also very sweet. There is an indoor as well as an outdoor pool and we used the exercise room as well. There is also a laundry area for guests. This Quality Inn is located in an excellent place with easy driving to all the Branson attractions. I would have no problem at all staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: rrteacher
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs a major overhaul. It has outdated everything in the rooms. The bed was comfy. Old carpet, bedding-the sheets were so thin, had to ask for towels, bathtub was stained, and had barely enough head room in the shower. The front desk staff was not very professional. This was booked for 2 free nights by an independent travel service. I would never have picked this hotel. We go to Branson a lot and this definitely would not have been my choice. If you are looking for a cheap hotel then this one is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great in spite of reviews”
Reviews.Author: bookworm82
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. We had stayed here on numerous trips in the past, but it had been a few years since. I was apprehensive about staying at this motel after reading all the bad reviews. I thought maybe it had really went down hill. But we found this was not the case. We stayed in the newer back building that is attached to the swimming pool area. We had no problems with our room and the staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. The pool was clean, though crowded since the hotel was full. My husband and kids ate the free breakfast and thought it was good. My husband always likes to stay here because they have biscuits and gravy. They also had bagels, various kinds of sweet rolls and donuts. We had a very enjoyable stay here and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty motel and Moldy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tourist2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Dec. '06 and will never make that mistake again. The only positive thing about this motel is the location. There are two buildings with the older building having outside entrances, not a good thing with ice on the steps leading to the 2nd story and nothing was done to keep people from falling. I slipped and my luggage went down the steps when I was trying to grab anything to keep myself from landing at the bottom. In order to use the pool, which is located in the other building, you have to again go down the icy steps, out into the cold, and walk quite a distance across the parking lot to the other building's entrance. We were in a room close to the street. This wasn't an enjoyable walk when you come out of the pool. The enclosed building which contains the pool is more expensive, but we weren't told you had to go outside to get to the pool when we made our reservation in the cheaper building. All of the rooms need updating and a general cleaning, especially the stained carpets and take other people's hair out of the shower . Breakfast is very limited and what is usually included in other continental breakfasts was being charged for and it looked disgusting and greasy. The other breakfast items were in short supply and my mini muffins were moldy. I asked other people at the tables if their muffins were moldy and they were. Also, our heater didn't work right room wouldn't get warm. When we called front desk they just hollered at us for complaning and wouldn't do anything to try to fix it or give us another room. We will never go back to this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in the Newer Building in the Back”
Reviews.Author: TravlingBard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on New Years Eve. From the street only the older building can be seen - there's a newer one in the back that is where we stayed. It was clean and the bed was just fine. Temp control was efficient and quiet. Large bathroom, nice extra touches such as a nicer shower curtain, good TV and channels, a comfortable, large armchair with table, luggage rack, refrigerator. We did not try out the pool area but this is also the building where it is and it looked very nice. Fine for the low price.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: mactravels
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel are friendly and the rooms are clean. Wireless connection was good. We spent four nights. However, I would not recommend this hotel or stay here again. The free continental breakfast every morning consisted of a couple of selections of dry cereal, several types of pasteries, biscuts and gravey, bruised fresh fruit, and juice, coffee, and milk. Scrambled eggs, sasuage, bacon or oatmeal, that are normally included in continental breakfast bars at other hotels were available for purchase. But only until 9:30 a.m.. Additionally, the eating area was crowded with too many tables and very dark. Cutlery was provided in a very unsanitary fashion. Additionally, the fire exit was blocked with a trash can and several highchairs. Housekeeping showed up to clean after 4 each day. Clean sheets were never provided nor was the room vacumed while we were there. The sheets didn't fit the beds and were very thin. Beds were uncomfortable. Wallpaper peeling off of the walls. Interior of rooms need to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Great, Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a five-night stay in Branson. I chose this hotel based on three factors--location, pets allowed, and price. First, let me say that the price was great, and all the employees we talked to were extremely friendly. We arrived in Branson earlier than expected (about two hours before check-in). The nice lady at the front counter called housekeeping and asked them to clean our room next so we could check in early. Everyone who works there is so friendly and helpful. About the rooms--ours was okay. It really could use an update, though. The carpet is old and dark red, and ours had a couple of stains on it. The coffeemaker had not been cleaned since the previous visitor, as it still had coffee in the bottom of the pot. The beds and bathroom were very clean, and we had no trouble at all with the air conditioner. We enjoyed the indoor pool as well. The free breakfast was nice for us...we aren't big breakfast people, though. They had a nice selection of donuts, bagels, muffins, fruit, and cereal. (Of course, they also have biscuits and gravy, too.) The location is fantastic. I strongly recommend staying somewhere on Shepherd of the Hills Expressway rather than on Hwy 76. At certain times in the day, the Strip gets very congested, but we were always able to easily get to our hotel with no problems All in all, it's an okay place, but I don't think we'll be going back. I think I'll pay a bit more next time for a newer room somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “great place, great people”
Reviews.Author: andgin
Reviews.Content: We had a good time at Quality Inn. Indoor pool area was great. Room was clean and location was exellent. Nothing wrong with our airconditioner. We even had to get up and turn it down because it was cold in our room. My daughter became ill while we were on vacation and we had to leave in the middle of the night. They were so generous and helpful. Thank you Quality Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: gohuskers
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on other reviews on here, we must not have stayed at the same place. The carpet was filthy -- not only did it look bad, but when I was finally brave enough to take my shoes off, the floor turned my socks black. Ewwww. The recliner in the room was also stained and disgusting. The room smelled also. When we were going to go to sleep, my husband pulled back the nasty comforter to find his pillow had something on it. Either lipstick or blood or something that should NOT be there. So we called and they did replace it very quickly. The iron was broken, water went everywhere. The bathroom floor (tile) was also gross, as it had not been swept in a while it had hair all over it. The shampoo had been used as it only had half of the product left in it. Not that I use their stuff, but the point of the matter is the room should look as if no guest has been there before. Where the floor board meets the wall, it looked bad the paint was chipping. The suspended ceiling tiles in the bathroom were mildewy and moldy. It was an unpleasant and uncomfortable stay. The good thing about the place was the location was terrific, the people were all very nice to us even when we complained, the breakfast was okay. At least it had biscuits and gravy for free and the donuts were okay. The front desk people did knock off another $10 off our stay, so it was $35. I guess you do get what you pay for. If you go through the branson's quality inn site (not the corporate site), you can get it for $42 a night. We were terribly disappointed in our stay here and expected it to be better based on a lot of reviews. We reserved only one night in case this happened, otherwise we would have reserved more nights once we got there. Try to see the rooms you are going to stay in before you reserve if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “Low standards and no air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: PlayfulPlatypus
Reviews.Content: If you want air conditioning or at least a cool room, this is NOT the place to stay during the warmer months which is most of the year. The hotel was full so we could not change rooms and the air conditioner could not keep the room cool even though it was only 83 degrees out. This was our second time to stay at this hotel and have the same problem. No towels were available at the pool. Great idea to have the washer and dryer next to the indoor pool so you can do laundry and play at the same time but on the flip side, do you want all these people to have access to your laundry? The breakfast was pitful. They wanted an extra $1 for oatmeal. The room was dark and dingy. They wanted an extra $1 for a soda. They had donuts galore. There was a car show happening in the parking lot right outside our room. People were just sitting out there all day long drinking and chatting. I would not recommend this hotel unless location is super important to you.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: daler_7
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights at the Quality Inn in Branson for less than $100.00 TOTAL including taxes, so we didn't expect the Hilton. As always, we checked TripAdvisor and saw some positive comments, so we made reservations. We have no complaints about our stay. The room was clean, we got a king-size bed as requested, we were offered the usual Branson time-share cash-and-show-deal but they weren't pushy at all when we declined; the housekeeper left us a nice note (with an accompanying envelope, ahem) and we responded with some suggestions (the TV remote didn't work properly, we'd like another blanket on the bed, etc) and came back to the room to find all of our requests met. Friendly people, nice low rate, good end of town, clean rooms. Continental breakfast was fine, included biscuits and gravy. Pool and hot tub were a treat, too. What else can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “really nice workers.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, and enjoyed the location, and the staff. Continental breakfast was not the best, but it was pleasant all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place To Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property and what a place it was! The room was just what we wanted on the ground floor and near the indoor pool! The Breakfast in the morning is fantastic! Lots of great items to choose from and they even had Biscuits & Gravy - You just couldn't ask for a better place to stay and the prices are reasonable too!!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Inn on Shepherd of the Hills Expressway”
Reviews.Author: takeatripsoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Quality Inn on Shepherd of the Hills Expressway. It was acceptable but the room was very small. When we sat on the recliner it almost went to the floor. The breakfast room was old and dingy and the free breakfast was cold and tasted terrible; especially the biscuits and gravy. What do they make this stuff out of?? Otherwise we love Branson and go twice a year. We try to stay in a different hotel each time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: mister41
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and the shower area appeared new. Shower was hard to get out of without anything to hang on to. Pool area was nice. Breakfast was nice and had several choices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: towerbug
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed one night. I specifically asked for a room close to pool. Got it. The room was very clean and quiet. Pool area is nice with hot tub. I noticed they clean it every morning. There are pool tables, arcade machines, and laundry facilities. Free cont. breakfast and you have the option to purchase additional items such as sausage, bacon, eggs, quiche for a few bucks ($3.00 or so...)in a nice cafe area. The people that work here are very, very nice. I would recommend this hotel especially for the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Branson Quality Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When visiting relatives in Branson, Mo., I had the pleasure of staying at the Quality Inn on Shepherd of the Hills Expressway. The room was extremely clean as well as tastefully decorated. I also enjoyed spending time with my daughter swimming in the lovely indoor pool. The staff was friendly and efficient, and it was a perfect location. We could walk to the spectacular Imax Theater for a movie, and then run across the street to Red Lobster for dinner. What a wonderful trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Quality Inn last month and really enjoyed our stay. The room was very clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. They made all of our music show reservations. The breakfast was better than most. I will go back.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 3269 Shepherd Hills Expressway, Branson, MO 65616
